Función de los bosques

Forests provide a habitat for a wide variety of plants and animals and fulfill many other functions that affect humans.

Along with others, these large plant communities are responsible, for example, for the production of oxygen during photosynthesis.

Photosynthesis is the chemical process by which green leaves and stems use sunlight and carbon dioxide to produce sugars that provide energy to the tree.

During the process, the foliage of the trees releases oxygen, a necessary element for breathing.
